content: VANET stands for "Vehicular Ad-hoc Network". It is a type of mobile ad-hoc network (MANET) in which vehicles communicate with each other and with fixed infrastructure networks using wireless communication. VANETs are designed to improve road safety and traffic efficiency by providing real-time information to vehicles and enabling advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS). They also offer various services such as traffic management, entertainment, and infotainment. VANETs can be classified into two types: infrastructure-based VANETs and infrastructureless VANETs.
